subject: AI & Agents
title: AlphaStar: Mastering StarCraft II
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on AlphaStar: Mastering StarCraft II.

hook.text: StarCraft II is the hardest competitive game for AI â€” fog of war, real-time strategy, deception.

buildup.text: DeepMind's AlphaStar trained on human replays and then refined through self-play.

discovery.text: It reached Grandmaster level on the official European ladder â€” top 0.2% of human players.

twist.text: Critics noted AlphaStar had faster-than-human reaction times. DeepMind capped its actions per minute.

climax.text: Even with speed limits, AlphaStar's strategic depth surpassed most human players.

punchline.text: Fast reflexes helped, but strategic genius won.

quiz.question: What made StarCraft II especially difficult for AI?
options: Fog of war, real-time decisions, and the need for deception
Simple rules with few possible moves
